routine.title: Dynamic Stretching & Movement Prep
audio: There will be 3 sets of 4 warm ups to activate muscles for your heavy squats.

audio.text: Let's get into the world greatest stretch, starting with the left side.

audio.lunge elbow down: Step forward into a lunge, bringing your elbow down to the floor.

audio.rotation hand up: Rotate your torso and reach your hand up towards the ceiling.

audio.lunge elbow down: Lunge and elbow down on the other side.

activity.activity: One and a Quarter Air Squat
audio: Next we have the one and a quarter air squat

audio.standing: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart

audio.squat hold: Lower into a squat position, going as low as you can while keeping your chest up
...then lower back down into the squat

audio.standing: Finally, stand all the way up to complete one rep

audio.text: Now let's do the 90/90 ER hinge, left side first.
Sit on the ground with one leg bent in front of you at a 90-degree angle and the other leg bent behind you also at a 90-degree angle
Place your hands on your hips and engage your core
Hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up
Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side

audio: Finally, we have the glute bridge
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart
Place your arms at your sides with palms facing down
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes as you lift your hips towards the ceiling
Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position
Start your lower body warm up on the rower.
Now we are ready for back squats. Let's practice the movement.

audio.standing: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, core engaged.

audio.descending: Sit back into your lowest position, keeping your chest up.

audio.squat hold: Hold for a second at the bottom.

audio.ascending: Stand up activating your glutes and driving through your heels.

audio.text: Grab your dumbbells for reverse lunges, starting with the left leg.
